comment: Hes a nice guy but the lectures can be boring. As long as you study just a little bit for the tests youll do fine. The class was unremarkable but you will learn a few things
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS WITH HIM. Dr. Lebaron is a horrible lecturer. He meanders from point to point and cannot deliver a cohesive narrative. There are minimal outside readings to supplement his class. So you're forced to rely on his geriatric mumbling on the topic for all the content. Would NEVER take again.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: His class was so easy. You could pass with your eyes closed. It took more of a laissez-faire approach so it was really easy. Just turn in the first couple of discussions. The longest thing I had to write for this class was 400 words.

This class is really easy as long as you do your part and turn in your assignments. He is very considerate so if you have any other problems outside of class, just email him and figure out a solution there. His assignments are relatively easy. The longest paper I had to write for that class was 400 words.
Slow powerpoint lectures, but offers insightful takes on concepts. Midterm and Final Exam are the only grades.

Ill be honest, the lectures can be a little slow; but the bottom line is that his number one concern is student success. He gave countless practice quizzes; he answered every question asked; he provided introspective, important outlooks on the subjects taught. Extremely genuine, intelligent guy that will provide help to anyone interested.

Prof. Lebaron is one of the most passionate professors I've had. His class is very focused on his lectures as well as the main concepts seen throughout world history. At times it can be a little slow, however this class is very interesting. He's a great professor.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Caring

comment: One word, boring. I had the hardest time keeping my eyes opened in class, the days I'd actually even go. He's a cute lil old man who is passionate about history but boy is he boring. Class is pretty easy. He's not too bad, I suggest taking him cause he's better than other professors can be.

His lectures are boring, but even though attendance is required you should go. They will help you a lot. You are only graded over 3 things 2 tests and 1 2500 word essay so take the assignments seriously. Also read the book it will help a lot.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I took his Honors world history class and it was the easiest class I've taken in my life. Final was pass/fail. Never read the book. Learned a ton. Show up and you'll be fine.

Prof. LeBaron is a very nice man.  He is more concerned that you understand the big picture--the content--of his course rather than pass a bunch of tests.  Participate in group discussions during class and do well on the project and you will make an A.  His class is always fun (he let us eat Chick-Fil-A during the final exam)!

Professor Lebaron is fun and willing to adjust the class to help your style. He doesn't want you to memorize dates or write huge papers. He only wants you to understand the repeated themes in History. His lectures were short and interesting but the room was always dark and it was hard not to feel tired.
Very nice guy. Very clear about what he expects, and it's always reasonable. Highly recommend.

He has definitely been one of the bright spots in my college career. He doesn't care as much about sticking to a set curriculum as he does just making sure you know the content. Has awesome stories and will do whatever he can to help you. Highly recommend
Alan was my study abroad professor in Italt. He is an amazing professor and an even more incredible man. I learned so much from him!

He's a good professor. Teaches fairly well, is extremely knowledgeable about South America, and doesn't take it too seriously. A paper, three tests, like that. Study the material and you're fine, he doesn't test too hard. Decent guy! I'd recommend to my friends.

He is such a nice guy, a little airey, but so nice! I ended up taking him for a summer class and got a B in the class. He does not do B+'s or B-'s which is pretty helpful for most! He is a nice guy and more than willing to help. He is understanding during the Maymester of the short time frame and is willing to helpout and be flexible.
Very nice and knowledgeable professor. He expects you to come to class having read the assigned materials. Do the reading and show up for class and you'll do just fine!

At first I thought it was going to be bad but Mr. LeBaron had definitely grown on me. Nice guy and very knowledgeable. Reasonable in his expectations and good at making the timeline of world history make sense. Come to class, pay attention and you'll be fine - actually may come out of it knowing something about the topic!

Easy A if you have an interest in history. He rambles about random topics and goes silent and stands there. I'm not the type to fall asleep in class, but I enjoyed naps in here a lot. Horribly boring and uninteresting. Workload small, reading material moderate, BORING beyond belief!
Dr. Lebaron is an awesome teacher. The books he selected for class were great. He grades very fairly. I would recommend his class!

I hated history before taking his class. He makes it genuinely interesting. Lazy people who prefer to skip class, then cram to remember names/dates before the final will not like this class(which you forget all the names/dates the day after the final exam). He assigns papers and gives you all that you need to get an A.
The most boring professor I've ever known. It's hard to stay awake in his class. He speaks softly and feebly because he's 60 or 70, and spaces out every 5 seconds.

Please disregard other post about this Professor. The class was an interesting class and an easy A as long as you came to class and paid attention. Two exams multiple choice and an essay in each. Final exam was a take home 5 page paper. He knows his stuff and works with you on your grade. I'll be taking him again in the fall for Hist of Brazil

Prof. Lebaron is not that bad. He does space out at times, however generally he knows his stuff. If you read text and follow along with him in class an A is a gurantee. The text makes for interesting reading and he tries to incorporate other fun text to bring his point across.

I had him for History of Mexico and Central America and it was fine. He's not the most interesting lecturer, but it wasn't bad. He doesn't take attendance, but I'd recommend going to class. For the tests, I just made a list of things to know and studied that. He was vague about the paper, but graded generously. FYI, I worked hard and got an A.

Heed my warning! DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR. I am dropping his class because he has no idea what he is doing. He drolls on and on in class about useless things that will not be on any of your test and you can barely hear his lectures! He has no experience teaching a history class and he will not inspire you to continue in your field.

He stops in the middle of a sentence and then continues on a COMPLETELY different topic!  You have to know lots of maps.  HELLO this is not a geography class!!  He tells you lots of info that you spend your time writing down for him to say but you don't need to do know that.  Most of what is lectured is not in book.

Just awful. He often came in at least ten minutes late. This class was Problems and Philosophies of the World, yet we only addressed US issues. The book used was interesting, but I learned very little from class.  He was very spacy and the last month of class was pointless because we had all grades in except the final which was an essay. Avoid him!

This man is unprepared, unprofessional, late to class, unclear in his expectations, and totally opaque in his methods of grading.  he is useless as an instructor and you will learn nothing from him. Neither will you receaive an "easy A" because despite his inadequate teaching he expects literary masterpieces from his students. Alas, he has tenure.

Dr. Lebaron has undoubtedly wasted a few brain cells in his research south of the border, but he is still great!  I had a bad attitude about the class at first because I was uninterested, but he facilitates interesting discussions and treats his students like ADULTS capable of thought and discussion.  Overall, he is good.
Very intelligent guy. He treats his class like adults. He wants to engage in discussions about topics. He DOES NOT spoon feed you the information.
Very boring and pointless. He goes on and on about absolutely nothing. He is very unorganized and has no agenda. Take this class with another professor, one that will teach you something!

This guy is great! He is really into South American history and he knows his stuff. Liberal professor, easy lecture, and easy grader. If you want to skip class and not do your work, don't take him. If you want to learn something, go for it!

omg... if you want to pay money to sleep through classes this is your man. he is extremely monotoned and i think you could drink 10 red bulls and have 5 days of sleep before each class and still fall alseep. not recommended

I'd have to agree with the other posts. He did pretty much admi wasting a few brain cells & is a total space. The class itself was great for class discussion and an easy A. Prof is one helluva nice guy but the lectures were like watching paint dry.

The class is easy but torture. He has to think about everything he says before he says it. Has pretty much said that he's wasted a few brain cells in his time. Easy A, but boring. Do not take in the summer 3 hour classes is too much for this guy. Focuses very much on the philosophical perspective of history.
I think this guy smokes pot ! total space cadet

*B*O*R*I*N*G* Class was absolutely horrible.  Prof is very monotone and all he talked about was how he lived in China for a few years.  Prof talks very slow. In mid-sentence he would forget what he was talking about, stare off into space, and then start talking about an entirely different topic.
